article:
'Growth factor receptor-bound protein 2' also known as 'Grb2' is an adaptor
protein involved in signal transduction/cell communication. In humans, the GRB2
protein is encoded by the GRB2 gene.

The protein encoded by this gene binds receptors such as the epidermal growth
factor receptor and contains one SH2 domain and two SH3 domains. Its two SH3
domains direct complex formation with proline-rich regions of other proteins,
and its SH2 domain binds tyrosine phosphorylated sequences. This gene is similar
to the sem-5 gene of [[Caenorhabditis elegans]], which is involved in the signal
transduction pathway. Two alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding
different isoforms have been found for this gene.
